publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2184 Brian Adam: Failure to Mainstream Aberdeen’s Great Northern Partnership SIP Projects—That the Parliament recognises the admirable work carried out by the Great Northern Social Inclusion Partnership’s (SIP) community partners since its inception; commends the SIP projects which have delivered vital front-line services to some of Aberdeen’s socially-excluded communities over the years, and regrets that Aberdeen City Council feels unable to mainstream these projects.
S2M-2184 Failure to Mainstream Aberdeen’s Great Northern Partnership SIP Projects (lodged on 17 December 2004) Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Michael Matheson*, Alex Neil*, Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-2184 Failure to Mainstream Aberdeen’s Great Northern Partnership SIP Projects (lodged on 17 December 2004) Stewart Stevenson*, Frances Curran*, Roseanna Cunningham*
S2M-2184 Failure to Mainstream Aberdeen’s Great Northern Partnership SIP Projects (lodged on 17 December 2004) Ms Sandra White*, Chris Ballance*
S2M-2184 Failure to Mainstream Aberdeen’s Great Northern Partnership SIP Projects (lodged on 17 December 2004) Mr Kenny MacAskill*
S2M-2184 Failure to Mainstream Aberdeen’s Great Northern Partnership SIP Projects (lodged on 17 December 2004) Dr Jean Turner*
